column4: Hello, guys. Maybe you can take a look at http://askubuntu.com/questions/53327/screen-is-going-crazy-after-connecting-to-wi-fi-network and help me? Please.
I can stand Windoze!
*cant
damn, Â´ this doesnt work
ironic, huh?
it recognize my device, but when  try to connect... it just doesnt do anything. just tried and thats all. fater few minutes it asks psw again/
any1 else?
Are you logging into unity or ubuntu classic or ubuntu classic no-effects
xubuntu - xfce.
Do you have desktop effects running?
what do u mean with that? There arent such mega effects in xfce. just simple desktop. and it works, ye.
What wifi card do you have?  What driver are you using?  What video card do you have. what driver are you using for that?

i have linksys wusb60n stick. i did all like in this tut - http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-wireless-networking-41/linksys-wusb600n-driver-and-dlink-dwl-ag132-driver-622449/ . i dont know what v0car i have, but its on-board. and no drivers for it. just native for linux.
reading...
What driver are you using right now then?  does lspci show the device??
can u tell me how to now what driver am i using? im new to linux. what info do u need and how can I get it?
sure, sudo lspci -k    Does that output show the device?  (if yes it will list the driver)  It is long.  You can use paste.ubuntu.com for me to read it if you like.
ty. gonna paste link to output after few mins.
ok
I am quite sure it won't show up there because it's a USB device.  But I wanted you to look to be sure
it gives me nothing. ;(
http://paste.ubuntu.com/645410/
(it is not there) Does the device show up in lsusb  ?  (this one is shorter)
ye, i do shows up in lsusb.
what is the output of sudo lsmod | grep rt28    ?
give a a sec.
sure
I was afraid of that.  Hang on
Can you sudo modprobe rt2800usb
sure
then do sudo lsmod | grep rt28  and see if it returns something (it should now)
k. but 2800 wasnt for v1? i have v2 and the numbers are different.
This website is the most up to date most reliable source:  http://linuxwireless.org/en/users/Devices/USB
It lists rt2800usb for all versions (it's for down on the list)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/645417/
can you get on a wifi network?

u mean.. connect? before i saw that there r no firmware for it. then i compile drivers, add something to blacklist and other stuff (not sure) - as said in that tut. and then it didnt show that there are no firmware. i can see all networks and when i try to connect my network... it asks for psw. i enter it... it tries to connect and after few minutes it ask for psw again.
That is the state of things right now?  You're confusing me a bit.
ask me if you arent clear about something. i will try to explain.
Are you getting errors about missing firmware right now?
no. all seems to be working. just i cant connect to my network.
alright hang on a second...
sure.
What is your card listed as in lsusb ?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/645419/ . wusn60n
run dmesg and look at the last 20 or so lines.  Does it say anything about missing firmware ?

I'm not really sure why that driver isn't working.  The site I linked does not list any documenation so I'm guessing the driver is incomplete.  Have a look at rt2x00 it's some graphical tool for the driver we modprobed.  If you restart the machine it will be back to how it was before I ran any commands. All we did was insert the rt2800 module and look around a bit.
gere r full output I got from dmesg. it seems that there arent a lot of drivers... ;( i really appreciate ur help... http://paste.ubuntu.com/645425/
whoa, those are all your radion driver freaking out.
It's incomplete so not very useful
im glad that it isnt my linksys.. =D
its all that i got from that cmd. or no?
Ahh, it's probably left over from last time it happened.  How did you get your graphics back after it freaked out?
last time? i installed linux today.
Last time that the grahpics freaked
hmm. i just unplugged computer from electricity. and thats all. all seems to worked.
what?
my computers screen wnt like in these images... http://askubuntu.com/questions/53327/screen-is-going-crazy-after-connecting-to-wi-fi-network and then i just plugged out my computer from electricity.
So it worked fine on battery power?
what battery power? its desktop. not laptop. i plugged out it and it shutted down. no electicity - its off. then i plugged electricity again and all worked.
I'm not sure what the problem is then :(
maybe its ebecause of 64 bits I have? in that topic... they say that it works only wth 32 bits. What do u think?
That sounds extremely likely to me
i dont like out-dated architetures, but I wiould better use 32 bits linux then 64 bits windoze. ;(
32 bits isn't outdated yet!
:D
eh.. gonna try 32 bits.
good luck friend!
thanks. if u need web page... contact me. im pro at that. ;)
Ha, I make websites too actually :)  Probably not as good as you though
its my official job. =P php, sql, html, css, js... kohana and jquery <3. u name it ;)
awesome
just in linux i suck. kinda =D
You'll learn.
if i will set up my computer. somehow. =D
Yes very likely.  What are you trying to get working?
hi. remember me? =D
you helped me yesterday with xubuntu.
I do remember
i get it working with 32 bits xubuntu. my wireless.
I don't remember the problem though.
OH yeah?  It works now?  Yay!
the bad news: i dont like xubuntu. im migrating to ubuntu 10.04.2 lts, 64 bits. i guess module dont like that 64 bits. dammit
I would stick with 32 bits in general for a while :)
At least it's clear what to do.
I will try last thing that could work. if it fails, i reinstall to 32 bits.
Yes, that should work.
can u stay here for a whi;e? I could need ur help. ^_^
I'm here.
it failed.
What did?
to install that driver for 64bits. now i gonna install 32 bits os.
yeah do that
why do they recomend 32 bits?
They wrote the driver, ask them.
no, i thought: wht do Ubuntu recomends 32 bits over 64 bits?
Because 64 bits is not mature yet and problems like yours arise still.
im back. It failed on 32 bits too.
my man. Im the guy who had problems with wi-fi. ;) http://askubuntu.com/questions/54152/how-to-configure-my-graphics-card
